DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia de Eletrnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1986), mestrado em Engenharia Eletrnica e Computao pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1988) e doutorado em Signal/Image/Parole - Institut National Polytechique de Grenoble (1992). Desde 1992, pesquisador do Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, Frana. Efetua pesquisa nas reas de percepo e produo da fala, desenvolvimento da linguagem e controle motor humano. Possui ampla experincia em projetos de pesquisa internacionais, como em projetos da Comunidade Europia e participao em financiamentos do National Institute of Health (NIH/USA) em colaborao com o Departamento de Psicologia da Universidade McGill. De 2001 a 2006 liderou a equipe "Sensorimotor Coordination" no Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences em Munique, investigando relaes entre percepo e ao. De 2007 a 2013 trabalhou no Lyon Neuroscience Research Center, aproximando-se da pesquisa clnica em audiologia e das neurocincias. Trabalha atualmente no Laboratoire de Psychologie et NeuroCognition (LPNC) de Grenoble.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Rafael Laboissire holds the degree of Electronics Engineer from the Technological Institute of Aeronautics (1986) , Master in Electronic Engineering and Computer Science from the Technological Institute of Aeronautics (1988 ) and Doctor in Signal/Image/Parole from the Institut National Polytechnique de Grenoble (1992). Since 1992 he is a researcher at the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, France, performing research in the areas of speech production and perception, language development and human motor control. He has large experience in international research projects, including projects of the European Community, and participation in funding from the National Institute of Health (NIH/USA) in collaboration with the Department of Psychology at McGill University. From 2001 to 2006 led the team "Sensorimotor Coordination" at the Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences in Munich, investigating relationships between perception and action. From 2007 to 2013 he worked at the Lyon Neuroscience Research Center, narrowing the connection with clinical research in audiology and neuroscience. Currently works at the Laboratoire de Psychologie et Neurocognition (LPNC) of Grenoble.

ENDERECO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO-EMPRESA: Laboratoire de Psychologie et NeuroCognition (CNRS UMR 5105)

MESTRADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Estudo de um modelo de reconhecimento de voz baseado em discriminao acstico-fontica

DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico
DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Prliminaires pour une Robotique de la Communication Parle : Inversion et Contrle d'un Modlle Articulatoire du Conduit Vocal

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de um Modelo Acstico Realista (e Antropomrfico) de Produo da Fala
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Convnio CNPq-CNRS (Frana) Processo: 910146/98-5 - A fala poder se tornar o meio de interao privilegiado entre o homem e os computadores, visto que a comunicao oral o meio de comunicao natural entre seres humanos. Para que isto acontea, os sistemas de codificao, reconhecimento e sntese da fala do futuro devero ser capazes de se adaptar s condies de comunicao, tal qual faria um ser humano. Este aspecto de ``antropomorfismo'' ainda est longe de ser integrado nos sistemas atuais, especialmente com respeito sntese da fala, por razes diversas, tais como: (1) os modelos utilizados atualmente para a produo do sinal de fala, tanto no nvel biomecnico quanto no nvel acstico, so extremamente simplificados; e (2) o conhecimento morfolgico e anatmico do trato vocal utilizado para a realizao de tais modelos consideravelmente reduzido. O objetivo deste projeto de cooperao internacional atacar estes problemas integrando, por um lado, uma modelagem da morfologia do trato vocal baseada em estudos experimentais e, por outro lado, modelos avanados de simulao acstica. A meta final o estabelecimento de modelos realistas de produo da fala que iro compor os sistemas futuros de comunicao homem/mquina. Em se atingindo a meta almejada, ter-se- desenvolvido um modelo que ser parte integrante da prxima gerao de sistemas de comunicao falada.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Centre de Recherche en Neurosciences de Lyon, INSERM U1028, CNRS UMR5292

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MORPHALA: Morphing Audiovisual da Fala para Estudos Psicofsicos e Animao de Talking Heads
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Neste projeto, busca-se desenvolver um sistema de morphing audiovisual que possa ser usado tanto para estudos psicofsicos que permitam a compreenso dos processos subjacentes integrao de estmulos audveis e visveis pelo ser humano, quanto para a construo de talking heads capazes de assumir rostos e vozes arbitrrios e para o estudo de interfaces homem-mquina antropomrficas. Este sistema, chamado de MORPHALA, desenvolvido com base nas relaes fsicas existentes entre a geometria do trato vocal e a acstica da fala e no fato de que o trato vocal molda grande parte da geometria facial durante a fala. Alm disso, so desenvolvidas tcnicas de morphing da face e da cabea baseadas na construo de uma malha (mesh) para a cabea, a qual pode ser progressivamente deformada para se atingir geometrias arbitrrias; em uma nova tcnica de morphing de fala capaz de gerar fala perceptivamente natural.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Speech MAPS - Sound-to-gesture inversion in speech
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the European Union under the FP-6 ESPRIT BRA (Basic Research Action) No. 6975. It was leaded by the Institut de la Communication Parle, Grenoble, France, and counted 14 partner laboratories through Europe. The goal of the project was to inverse the speech sounds in order to obtain the gestures that generated it, with foreseen improvements in speech recognition/synthesis and a better understanding of action/perception relationship in speech. My specific task was to buiid an articulatory "speech robot" capable of generating intelligible sentences from the acoustical specification in its input.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project was funded by the European Union under the FP-6 ESPRIT BRA (Basic Research Action) No. 6975. It was leaded by the Institut de la Communication Parle, Grenoble, France, and counted 14 partner laboratories through Europe. The goal of the project was to inverse the speech sounds in order to obtain the gestures that generated it, with foreseen improvements in speech recognition/synthesis and a better understanding of action/perception relationship in speech. My specific task was to buiid an articulatory "speech robot" capable of generating intelligible sentences from the acoustical specification in its input.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Speech MAPS - Sound-to-gesture inversion in speech

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded in the context of CNRS' Cognisciences programme. It was developed together with Jean Paillous and Mireille Bonnard (CNRS URA 1166, Marseille) and Pierre Bessire (Leibniz-IMAG, Grenoble). Its goal was to applied the principles of human motor control and bayesian inferences to the understanding of speech motor control.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project was funded in the context of CNRS' Cognisciences programme. It was developed together with Jean Paillous and Mireille Bonnard (CNRS URA 1166, Marseille) and Pierre Bessire (Leibniz-IMAG, Grenoble). Its goal was to applied the principles of human motor control and bayesian inferences to the understanding of speech motor control.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Models of motor coordination and human-machine dialog
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the French-Italian Integrated Action Programme GALILEE and was developed in collaboration with Pietro Morasso and Vittorio Sanguineti (DIST, Genova University). We developed biomechanical and neurophysiological models of tongue movement control and coupled it with the jaw/hyoid model developed by me in another project.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the National Institutes of Health NHI grant #2R01DC00594-08A2, whose principal investigator was Dr. Vincent Gracco and in collaboration with Prof. David Ostry (McGill University, Montreal, Canada, and Haskins LAboratories, New Haven, USA). My participation in this project was the development of a biomechanical and neurophysiological model of the control of the human jaw and hyoid bone in speech. This model was applied to the study of perturbations of jaw movement, both natural, like the gravity, and artificial, throught jaw splint pertrubator robots.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project was funded by the National Institutes of Health NHI grant #2R01DC00594-08A2, whose principal investigator was Dr. Vincent Gracco and in collaboration with Prof. David Ostry (McGill University, Montreal, Canada, and Haskins LAboratories, New Haven, USA). My participation in this project was the development of a biomechanical and neurophysiological model of the control of the human jaw and hyoid bone in speech. This model was applied to the study of perturbations of jaw movement, both natural, like the gravity, and artificial, throught jaw splint pertrubator robots.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Sensorimotor Control of Human Jaw Movement
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the National Institutes of Health NHI grant #1R01DC004669-01A2, whose principal investigator was Prof. David Ostry (McGill University, Montreal, Canada, and Haskins LAboratories, New Haven, USA). My participation in this project was related to the development of techniques for estimating the stifness of the jaw during speech and non-speech movements.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Use of wavelets for thresholding, mixed-effects modelling and the classification of eletrophysiological signals: Study of exogenous and endogeneous effects of the Speech ABR
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project is funded by the IXXI (Rhne Alpes Complex Systems Institute). It is developed in collaboration with Irne Gannaz (Institut Camille Jordan, Lyon), Marianne Clausel (Laboratoire Jean Kuntzmann, Grenoble), and Fabien Millioz (Centre de Recherche en Neuroscience de Lyon). It is aimed at studying the categorisation of speech sounds in eletrophysiological auditory evoked responses to speech sounds.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project is funded by the IXXI (Rhne Alpes Complex Systems Institute). It is developed in collaboration with Irne Gannaz} (Institut Camille Jordan, Lyon), Marianne Clausel (Laboratoire Jean Kuntzmann, Grenoble), and Fabien Millioz (Centre de Recherche en Neuroscience de Lyon). It is aimed at studying the categorisation of speech sounds in eletrophysiological auditory evoked responses to speech sounds.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded in the context of Programmes Exploratoires Pluridisciplinaires (PEPS-CNRS) in Control Theory, and developed in collaboration with Richard Moreau and Minh Tu Pham (.Laboratoire Ampre, INSA, Lyon). The goal was to use an exoskeleton for the upper limb in psychophysical experiments in human motor control.

The goal was to use an exoskeleton for the upper limb in psychophysical experiments in human motor control.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Centre de Recherche en Neurosciences de Lyon, INSERM U1028, CNRS UMR5292

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Real-time psychophysical study of the perception-action loop in natural and artificial interfaces
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by a grant from DGA (Direction Gnrale de l'Armement, France) #08c0051. The aim was to develop a platform for studying visuo-motor coordination in combination of saccadic and upper-limb human movements. I developed a model for predicting the intended goal during ballistic pointing movements of the brachio-manual human system.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project was funded by a grant from DGA (Direction Gnrale de l'Armement, France) #08c0051. The aim was to develop a platform for studying visuo-motor coordination in combination of saccadic and upper-limb human movements. I developed a model for predicting the intended goal during ballistic pointing movements of the brachio-manual human system.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Real-time psychophysical study of the perception-action loop in natural and artificial interfaces

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Geometric aspects and neuronal basis of movement control in speech
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the French-Italian agency Cotrao (Communaut de Travail des Alpes Occidentales) through a post-doctoral scholarship granted to Vittorio Sanguinetti. This project aimed at developing a neurophysiological model of the control of tongue movements during speech.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Laboratoire de Psychologie et NeuroCognition (CNRS UMR 5105)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Adaptive procedures for improving the estimation of psychometric respponses: Application to a phoneme identification task
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Development of a new adaptive technique for faster and more accurate estimation of the parameters of the psychometric response of a subject. This is being applied to a batterie of phonemic identification task, in order to build a normative database of responses, that will be used in the future for diagnosing speech/language disorders. We obtained a grant from Grenoble Cognition Pole for supporting the M2R internship of Florent Clerc between February and July 2014.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Neurophysiological representation of phonemic units in speech: Application to the diagnoses of language disorders
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In this project, we develop techniques for the classification of electropencephalograpy signals obtained from evoked responses to ambiguous phonemic signals. The goal is to cope with the dimension reduction of the data and localize the central nervous system structures involved in phonemic categorization. This project is funded by the programme Projets Exploratoires Premier Soutien (PEPS) Interdisciplinaires, Grenoble.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Stochastic Modelling of Speech Motor Control
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the European Union under the programmeTraining and Mobility of Researchers (TMR) through a post-doctoral scolarship granted to Gordon Ramsay. The goal of the project was to develop techniques of estimation of biomechanical properties of the musculo-cartilageneous-skeletal structures of the vocal tract.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Stochastic Modelling of Speech Motor Control
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the European Union under the programmeTraining and Mobility of Researchers (TMR) through a post-doctoral scolarship granted to Gordon Ramsay. The goal of the project was to develop techniques of estimation of biomechanical properties of the musculo-cartilageneous-skeletal structures of the vocal tract.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded in the framework of an international ATIP (Actions Thmatiques et Incitatives sur Programme) between France (CNRS) and Gernany (Max-Planck Society). It allowed me to create and lead a Junior Research Group in the Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences, Munich, during five years. The group was composed by technical staff (Vitor Torres and Marcelo Elias de Oliveira), post-doc fellows (Ken Ohta and Arturo Galvn-Rodrguez), doctoral students (Anne Hberle and Michiko Inoue) and a visiting scientist (Francisco Valero-Cuevas). The activities of the group was centered into the relationships between human action and perception, using a wide range of modeliling developments and empirical studies, using motion capture and movement perturbation devices. Studies in speech, upper-limb and locomotion were undertaken.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project was funded in the framework of an international ATIP (Actions Thmatiques et Incitatives sur Programme) between France (CNRS) and Gernany (Max-Planck Society). It allowed me to create and lead a Junior Research Group in the Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences, Munich, during five years. The group was composed by technical staff (Vitor Torres and Marcelo Elias de Oliveira), post-doc fellows (Ken Ohta and Arturo Galvn-Rodrguez), doctoral students (Anne Hberle and Michiko Inoue) and a visiting scientist (Francisco Valero-Cuevas). The activities of the group was centered into the relationships between human action and perception, using a wide range of modeliling developments and empirical studies, using motion capture and movement perturbation devices. Studies in speech, upper-limb and locomotion were undertaken.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Pati Papa? Modelling of the emergence of an articulated language in a society of sensorimotor agents in Interaction
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by an "Action Concerte" of the CNRS on Complex Systems in Social and Human Sciences and developed in collaboration with the Institu de la Communciation Parle, Grenoble, France. In this project, I did empirical studies in the coordination of hand pointing and speech movements, together with Amlie Rochet-Capellan.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project was funded by an "Action Concerte" of the CNRS on Complex Systems in Social and Human Sciences and developed in collaboration with the Institu de la Communciation Parle, Grenoble, France. In this project, I did empirical studies in the coordination of hand pointing and speech movements, together with Amlie Rochet-Capellan.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Max-Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estimation of neurally modulated finger mechanical properties during dynamic manipulation via discrete perturbations
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was funded by the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation, Germany, through a Research Award granted to Prof. Francisco Valero-Cuevas, who was at the time Prof. at the Cornell University, USA. The goal of the project was to investigate the integration of visual and tactile sensory input for dynamic manipulation. Our experimental data and computational modeling revealed that time-delays are as critical to task-optimal multisensory integration as sensorimotor noise.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LABOISSIERE, R. M.;Laboissiere, R.;Laboissire, Rafael;Laboissi?re, Rafael;LABOISSIERE, R;LABOISSIERE, RAFAEL;Rafael Laboissire;LABOISSIRE, R.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto foi financiado por uma ctedra do IEAT (Instituto de Estudos Avanados Transdisciplinares, UFMG) e foii realizado, parcialmente, durante uma visita de trs meses UFMG, em colaborao com a Profa. Thas Cristfaro (FALE,UFMG), o Prof. Maurcio Alves Loureiro (Escola de Msica, UFMG) e Hani Yehia (DELT, UFMG). O tema central deste projeto o estudo do movimento humano e da fala, com especial nfase em experimentos psicofsicos e no embasamento na Neurocincia.
